abstract: Op-Ed article by university student Harpreet Singh Saini faults South Carolina for being among five American states without laws enhancing penalties for bias-motivated crimes; holds local hate crime laws are frequently more effective in bringing justice to victims than seeking federal hate crime conviction; supports efforts by South Carolina activists to bring about such legislation following shooting at black church in Charleston.
lead_paragraph: After Charleston, every state must make attacks­ based on bigotry a crime.

headline.main: There Ought to Be a Law Against Hate
headline.print_headline: There Ought to Be a Law Against Hate
